{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is on amphotericin B which can cause hypokalemia due to its effect on potassium reabsorption. Therefore, the goal of supplementation is to restore normal potassium levels. The choice that stands out as a reasonable approach is option D: 120-160 mEq over 24 hours, as this range is consistent with other reports of amphotericin B-induced hypokalemia and its treatment.", "answer_choice": "D"}
